00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Support functions for managing the MII management port
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 99583 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef __CVMX_MGMT_PORT_H__
00049 #define __CVMX_MGMT_PORT_H__
00050 
00051 #include "cvmx-helper.h"
00052 #include "cvmx-helper-board.h"
00053 
00054 #ifdef __cplusplus
00055 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00056 extern "C" {
00057 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #define CVMX_MGMT_PORT_NUM_PORTS        2   /* Right now we only have one mgmt port */
00061 #define CVMX_MGMT_PORT_NUM_TX_BUFFERS   16  /* Number of TX ring buffer entries and buffers */
00062 #define CVMX_MGMT_PORT_NUM_RX_BUFFERS   128 /* Number of RX ring buffer entries and buffers */
00063 #define CVMX_MGMT_PORT_TX_BUFFER_SIZE   12288   /* Size of each TX/RX buffer */
00064 #define CVMX_MGMT_PORT_RX_BUFFER_SIZE   1536    /* Size of each TX/RX buffer */
00065 
00066 typedef enum {
00067     CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS = 0,
00068     CVMX_MGMT_PORT_NO_MEMORY = -1,
00069     CVMX_MGMT_PORT_INVALID_PARAM = -2,
00070     CVMX_MGMT_PORT_INIT_ERROR = -3,
00071 } cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t;
00072 
00073 /* Enumeration of Net Device interface flags. */
00074 typedef enum {
00075     CVMX_IFF_PROMISC = 0x100,   /* receive all packets           */
00076     CVMX_IFF_ALLMULTI = 0x200,  /* receive all multicast packets */
00077 } cvmx_mgmt_port_netdevice_flags_t;
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Enum of MIX interface modes
00081  */
00082 typedef enum {
00083     CVMX_MGMT_PORT_NONE = 0,
00084     CVMX_MGMT_PORT_MII_MODE,
00085     CVMX_MGMT_PORT_RGMII_MODE,
00086 } cvmx_mgmt_port_mode_t;
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * Called to initialize a management port for use. Multiple calls
00090  * to this function accross applications is safe.
00091  *
00092  * @param port   Port to initialize
00093  *
00094  * @return CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
00095  */
00096 extern cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_initialize(int port);
00097 
00098 /**
00099  * Shutdown a management port. This currently disables packet IO
00100  * but leaves all hardware and buffers. Another application can then
00101  * call initialize() without redoing the hardware setup.
00102  *
00103  * @param port   Management port
00104  *
00105  * @return CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
00106  */
00107 extern cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_shutdown(int port);
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * Enable packet IO on a management port
00111  *
00112  * @param port   Management port
00113  *
00114  * @return CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
00115  */
00116 extern cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_enable(int port);
00117 
00118 /**
00119  * Disable packet IO on a management port
00120  *
00121  * @param port   Management port
00122  *
00123  * @return CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
00124  */
00125 extern cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_disable(int port);
00126 
00127 /**
00128  * Send a packet out the management port. The packet is copied so
00129  * the input buffer isn't used after this call.
00130  *
00131  * @param port       Management port
00132  * @param packet_len Length of the packet to send. It does not include the final CRC
00133  * @param buffer     Packet data
00134  *
00135  * @return CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
00136  */
00137 extern cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_send(int port, int packet_len, void *buffer);
00138 
00139 /**
00140  * Receive a packet from the management port.
00141  *
00142  * @param port       Management port
00143  * @param buffer_len Size of the buffer to receive the packet into
00144  * @param buffer     Buffer to receive the packet into
00145  *
00146  * @return The size of the packet, or a negative erorr code on failure. Zero
00147  *         means that no packets were available.
00148  */
00149 extern int cvmx_mgmt_port_receive(int port, int buffer_len, void *buffer);
00150 
00151 /**
00152  * Set the MAC address for a management port
00153  *
00154  * @param port   Management port
00155  * @param mac    New MAC address. The lower 6 bytes are used.
00156  *
00157  * @return CVMX_MGMT_PORT_SUCCESS or an error code
00158  */
00159 extern cvmx_mgmt_port_result_t cvmx_mgmt_port_set_mac(int port, uint64_t mac);
00160 
00161 /**
00162  * Get the MAC address for a management port
00163  *
00164  * @param port   Management port
00165  *
00166  * @return MAC address
00167  */
00168 extern uint64_t cvmx_mgmt_port_get_mac(int port);
00169 #define CVMX_MGMT_PORT_GET_MAC_ERROR ((unsigned long long)-2LL)
00170 
00171 /**
00172  * Set the multicast list.
00173  *
00174  * @param port   Management port
00175  * @param flags  Interface flags
00176  *
00177  * @return
00178  */
00179 extern void cvmx_mgmt_port_set_multicast_list(int port, int flags);
00180 
00181 /**
00182  * Set the maximum packet allowed in. Size is specified
00183  * including L2 but without FCS. A normal MTU would corespond
00184  * to 1514 assuming the standard 14 byte L2 header.
00185  *
00186  * @param port   Management port
00187  * @param size_without_fcs
00188  *               Size in bytes without FCS
00189  */
00190 extern void cvmx_mgmt_port_set_max_packet_size(int port, int size_without_fcs);
00191 
00192 /**
00193  * Return the link state of an RGMII/MII port as returned by
00194  * auto negotiation. The result of this function may not match
00195  * Octeon's link config if auto negotiation has changed since
00196  * the last call to __cvmx_mgmt_port_link_set().
00197  *
00198  * @param port     The RGMII/MII interface port to query
00199  *
00200  * @return Link state
00201  */
00202 extern cvmx_helper_link_info_t cvmx_mgmt_port_link_get(int port);
00203 
00204 /**
00205  * Configure RGMII/MII port for the specified link state. This
00206  * function does not influence auto negotiation at the PHY level.
00207  *
00208  * @param port      RGMII/MII interface port
00209  * @param link_info The new link state
00210  *
00211  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00212  */
00213 extern int cvmx_mgmt_port_link_set(int port, cvmx_helper_link_info_t link_info);
00214 
00215 #ifdef __cplusplus
00216 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00217 }
00218 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00219 #endif
00220 #endif /* __CVMX_MGMT_PORT_H__ */
